question: Which Indian bank has launched a campaign named ‘Safety Grid’, to encourage people maintain social distancing while waiting at public places?
explanation:
HDFC Bank has launched a campaign named ‘Safety Grid’, to encourage people maintain social distancing while waiting at public places.
The campaign was launched in Kolkata on a pilot basis and has been extended to many cities including Delhi, Mumbai and Bengaluru among others. The safety grid markers are physically painted in front of the retail outlets and ATMs, where people wait. Each grid is spaced at one metre from each other, as prescribed by the WHO.
